page.title: 04Comet Youth Club Wigan
page.content: Comet Youth Club was built by various volunteer groups and opened in 1964. It has 230 members all with a membership card. Youth members are 13-21, Junior members are under 13. Funds are raised mostly by volunteers plus a little help from Wigan Metro. Qualified Leaders run the many activities on offer eg. drama, dancing, art competitions, community help, discussion groups, netball and football teams. Jerrard's sister is in the netball team.They just won a final. Weekend trips and Exchange Groups are organised so are play schemes during the school holidays. Membership is open to anyone but troublemakers are warned three times then banned. Parents are welcome too. The club which opens on Mondays and Fridays has 6 paid staff and 4 volunteers plus some Junior Leaders aged 18-25. It is a most valuable asset to our community.
